trends: There have been 4 other sightings in Towson
There was one other sighting in Towson on or around September 19th 2009
divs: sighting detailsapprox 8 pm - approx 58 degrees - i was located in lutherville at a friends birthday party when i looked up towards the eastern sky, towards direction of whitemarsh\parkville, and saw a bright white light appear. we were in his backyard grilling at the time. the light appeared to evolve from darkness, not like a light you turn on by switch, but it grew brighter (holding in elevation at the time). the light source was circular in shape and projected light in a cone shape straight downward. light was similar to a helicopter spotlight (electrictronically enduced spotlight - not a flame, not a fire, but manufactured). there was no sound associted with this light or smoke. a large plume of smoke was below the lighted object- fog like - like a street light in the fog, except massive. the light was as bright as jet aircraft landing apprroach lights, if not brighter. the light source began to slowly lower in elevation approx 500 ft? ?...light began to slowly go out (still holding at the same elevation it seemed (like it did not travel away or up). the large area of fog smoke below object remained lighted for approx 10 seconds then faded to black. visibilty this night was clear, no clouds. shortly their after all the smoke was gone, commercial aircraft flew by where the sighting occured around same elevation. aircraft headed south. i have studied aviation since childhood and seen rockets, hovering helicopters, harrier jets in air shows, and nothing compares to what i saw this night. the fact that there was no sound associated with this event leaves me to belive that it was not military\commercial aircraft. as noted, a commercial ailiner passed by site approx 10-30 seconds after event (right where sighting was in sky) and jet's engine noise could be clearly heard at this distance. i had felt that i had seen something that was man made, but not normal. i called 911 around 8:15 and reported incident annonamously, i was told it was probably fireworks occuring at towson university - not possible. i asked that if they had been flooded with callers, and operator said that they had not as of yet. three people at the party also saw event.
Summary: hovering circle - bright light - projected light cone, around 5,000 ft estimated
